pageContext.claim: “Then I imposed it in Europe also, heavily infected with Italy and France and Spain.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump touts his restrictions on travel from the European Union as effective. (It was not all of "Europe" as he constantly says.) But a Washington Post examination found that his abrupt decision led to one final viral infusion before the country was forced to shut down. "The lapses surrounding the spread from Europe stand alongside other breakdowns — in developing diagnostic tests, securing protective gear and imposing social distancing guidelines — as reasons the United States became so overwhelmed," The Post reported. "The travel mayhem was triggered by many of the same problems that plagued the U.S. response to the pandemic from the outset: Early warnings were missed or ignored. Coordination was chaotic or nonexistent. Key agencies fumbled their assignments. Trump’s errant statements undermined his administration’s plans and endangered the public."
